TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
So the issue with not being able to reply seems to be just a symptom.  When the forum is in that "lockdown" state, I've also noticed that the "Share Post" button is misbehaving.  Instead of giving you a link directly to the post, it refreshes the page as if you'd clicked on the link it's supposed to give you.

No amount of cache clearing and refreshing brought me out this time.  Had to restart Firefox.  And it's not like I had the forums sitting open all night, I had just launched FF this morning and the forums were instantly in this mode.  I absolutely hate Chrome/Chromium, so I hope this bug can be identified and fixed.  If the staff here needs any debug information from when it happens again, I'll be more than happy to provide it.

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, Geonovast said:
> 
> 
> I had to hard refresh a few times just to get the ability to post this back.
> 
> 
> 
> 

Getting posts back? As in the editor? I have had multiple issues with just the opposite! I remember I was going to type in the "What did you do in KSP today" thread, and when I was about to type up my thing for the F-11 Viper (See the thread for details) a multi-paragraph "news article" came back from when I landed on the Mun last summer!
Oh no, I think you misunderstood. I was referring to getting the *ability to post* a reply back by hard refreshing.

I just liked a post, then the forum instantly removed it, and popped up the black notification box saying "Your reaction has been removed"

I tried to get a SS by clicking like again, but it went through the second time..

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, tater said:
> 
> 
> Forum works on the Mac in Chrome, but not Firefox (my usual browser), or Safari (which I don't really use).
> 

I have the exact same problem!

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Earthlinger said:
> 
> 
> I have the exact same problem!
> 

OK, it's not just me. I am typing this on Firefox right now. It seems intermittent. Earlier this morning, Chrome didn't work, either, then started working. I had never seen this behavior until yesterday.

> 
> 
> Just now, tater said:
> 
> 
> OK, it's not just me. I am typing this on Firefox right now. It seems intermittent. Earlier this morning, Chrome didn't work, either, then started working. I had never seen this behavior until yesterday.
> 

Our computers must be protesting

Perhaps mine got annoyed over that soup I spilled on part of it.....

Stopped working for me again, all browsers. Works on phone. Only ksp forum affected.

if I hit create new topic, all fields work except the one where you type content.

> 
> 
> 4 minutes ago, tater said:
> 
> 
> Stopped working for me again, all browsers. Works on phone. Only ksp forum affected.
> 

It stopped working for me on all browsers too, but after like twenty minutes it fixed itself somehow

Lol

The web inspector shows a bunch of js errors.

I've been having the same problem on-and-off all day. At first I thought the mods were just fed up with my nonsense. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

![RefError.png](http://u.cubeupload.com/Geonovast/RefError.png)

"ReferenceError: ips is not defined" is not there when things are kosher.

Not sure how much this helps, but I was just locked out for a good hour in FF and Chrome.

Okay, I'm told that our IT guy is chasing down a small collection of weirdnesses. Sorry for the trouble, folks.

Same complaint. On again, off again, gone again finnegan
